name: denisparra.github.io
tagline: Denis Parra, Assistant Professor at PUC Chile
body:
# News

I am local and publicity chair at the **ACM Hypertext Conference 2014**, which will be held at PUC Chile in September 1-4 of 2014. See more information at [ht.acm.org/ht2014](http://ht.acm.org/ht2014)


# Last Publications
* Lacic, E., Kowald, D., Parra, D., Kahr, M. and Trattner, C.: _Towards a Scalable Social Recommender Engine for Online Marketplaces: The Case of Apache Solr_, In Proceedings of the ACM World Wide Web Conference companion (WWW 2014), ACM, New York, NY, 2014. (in press)
* Trattner, C., Parra, D., Eberhard, L. and Wen, X.: _Who will Trade with Whom? Predicting Buyer-Seller Interactions in Online Trading Platforms through Social Networks_, In Proceedings of the ACM World Wide Web Conference (WWW 2014), ACM, New York, NY, 2014. (in press)
* Han, S., Hsiao, H., and Parra, D.:_A Study of Mobile Information Exploration with Multi-Touch Interactions_, In Proceedings of the 2014 International Social Computing, Behavioral Modeling and Prediction Conference (SBP 2014), Washington, DC, USA, 2014 (in press) 
* Parra, D., Brusilovsky, P. and Trattner, C.: _User Controllability in an Hybrid Talk Recommender System_, In Proceedings of the ACM 2014 International Conference on Intelligent User Interfaces (IUI 2014), ACM, New York, NY, USA, 2014. (in press)
* Wen,X., Parra, D. and Trattner, C.: _How groups of people interact with each other on Twitter during academic conferences_, In Proceedings of the 2014 ACM Conference on Computer Supported Cooperative Work (CSCW 2014), ACM, Baltimore, Maryland, USA. (in press)

# Teaching

## Graduate
First Semester 2014: Data Mining (Master Program [MPGI](http://mpgi.ing.puc.cl/)) 

## Undergraduate
First Semester 2014: Exploratory to the Major in Computer Science

# Reviewing activities

## Journal
Interacting with Computers, Oxford University Press

## Conference
* Web Science Track at WWW 2014
* SocialCom 2014
* ACM Hypertext 2014
* MSM 2014 Workshop, collocated at WWW 2014
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
